com.communote.server.api.core.note.processor

Interface NoteMetadataRenderingPreProcessor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Orderable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CreateRepostNoteMetadataRenderingPreProcessor, LikeNoteRenderingPreProcessor, RepostNoteRenderingPreProcessor, RichMediaLinkRendererPreProcessor

    public interface NoteMetadataRenderingPreProcessor
extends Orderable
    This pre-processor is called before a note is rendered and thus provides a flexible way for making additional modifications to the metadata of a note. However, the content cannot be modified by this preprocessor.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_ORDER
      default order value

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Processes a note for a specific render context.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_ORDER

        static final int DEFAULT_ORDER
        default order value
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getOrder

        int getOrder()
        Specified by:
        getOrder in interface Orderable
        Returns:
        the order value which is interpreted as the priority of the pre-processor. The higher the priority, the earlier this processor will be called.

      • process

        boolean process(NoteRenderContext context,
                NoteData item)
         throws NoteRenderingPreProcessorException
        Processes a note for a specific render context. This method will only be called if the processor supports the mode given by the render context.
        Parameters:
        context - holds details about the render context to allow specific processing in different situations
        item - the item to be processed
        Returns:
        true if the item was modified, false otherwise
        Throws:
        NoteRenderingPreProcessorException - in case something unexpected lead to the failure of the processor

      • supports

        boolean supports(NoteRenderMode mode)
        Whether the processor supports a specific render mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - the note render mode, never null
        Returns:
        true if the mode can be handled by the processor, false otherwise
